awd_titl_txt: Response of Layered Deposits to Traveling Surface Pressure  Waves
awd_abstract_narration: A new method of analysis will be utilized to study the response of              horizontally layered saturated soil to traveling surface pressure               loads.  This method accounts for factors such as coupling between               the soil-water system, the effects of nonlinear soil properties,                inertia, and damping of the soil.  The proposed method is                       computationally efficient and is based on an existing methodology               for the study of soil deposits subject to wave loading.                                                                                                         The predictive capability of the proposed model will be verified                against existing finite element programs such as SAP4 and also                  against field data from Frenchman Flat, Nevada.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
